H0.text: Friction is the force that caused the ball to slow down as it rolled across the floor and eventually came to a stop.

H1.text: Gravity is the force that caused the ball to slow down as it rolled across the floor until it stopped.

H2.text: Magnetic force caused the ball to slow down as it rolled across the floor and came to a stop.

H3.text: Inertia is the force that caused the ball to slow down to a stop as it rolled across the floor.

A4.text: the force of friction is always exerted in a direction that opposes movement (for kinetic friction) or potential movement (for static friction)

A5.text: rolling resistance is the force that resists the rolling of a wheel or other circular object along a surface caused by deformations in the object or surface
